Water ecosystem construction technology This technology is suitable for improving the self-purification ability of water bodies by building a "clean water-type ecosystem" that utilizes aquatic plants and biodiversity to enhance the self-purification and ecological health of lakes.

Noise mainly comes from compressors, pump motors, fans, throttle valves, etc., especially in areas with environmental sensitive points nearby. Pollutant emission monitoring technology Suitable for monitoring multiple categories of pollutants, including online monitoring devices for rapid automatic detection, achieving real-time monitoring of atmospheric pollutants such as sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, and particulate matter.

Water pollution monitoring technology This technology is suitable for complex wastewater treatment. By installing automatic monitoring equipment at the discharge outlet, continuous monitoring of indicators such as pH, chemical oxygen demand, total nitrogen, and total phosphorus can be conducted.

Unorganized emission monitoring technology Applicable to unorganized emission points such as oil and gas gathering and transportation, monitoring non-methane total hydrocarbons and volatile organic compound emissions for effective management and reduction.

Solid waste management and monitoring technology Used to track and record the generation, treatment, and storage processes of solid waste, ensuring the proper management of hazardous wastes such as oil sludge and spent catalysts.

ICP-MS (Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry) Technology This technology is suitable for the accurate quantitative analysis of metal elements in samples and can detect metal elements in PM2.5 samples, ensuring the accuracy of pollution analysis.

Microwave digestion technology This technology is used for sample pre-treatment by heating and digesting solid particles, allowing metal elements to be released from the particles for ICP-MS analysis.
